meanings.definition: The art or practice of designing and constructing buildings.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, the architectures of the pyramids were truly remarkable.
meanings.sent2: Modern architectures often focus on sustainability and innovation.
meanings.sent3: The architectures of the gingerbread house in the story seemed almost magical.
meanings.sent4: Her dream had intricate architectures, like a city made of glass.
meanings.sent5: The architectures of the cathedral were so grand that they left visitors in awe.

meanings.definition: The structure or organization of a system or process.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the architectures of a computer system can help in troubleshooting.
meanings.sent2: The architectures of the company's management were reorganized for better efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The architectures of the ant colony were surprisingly complex for such tiny creatures.
meanings.sent4: The architectures of the legal system can sometimes be confusing to navigate.
meanings.sent5: The architectures of the plan were so well thought out that everything fell into place smoothly.

meanings.definition: The style or manner of building or constructing something.
meanings.sent1: The architectures of the new bridge combined modern design with functionality.
meanings.sent2: His unique architectures in pottery made him a renowned artist.
meanings.sent3: The architectures of her cake decorating were both beautiful and delicious.
meanings.sent4: The architectures of the fashion industry are constantly evolving.
meanings.sent5: The architectures of the garden were so harmonious that it felt like a work of art.
